Package com.xebisco.yield

Class YldGame

java.lang.Object
com.xebisco.yield.YldB
com.xebisco.yield.YldScene
com.xebisco.yield.YldGame
Direct Known Subclasses:
MyGame
public class YldGame extends YldScene
This class is the starting point for every Yield Game, it contains all the objects of the game.
Since:
4_alpha1

    • launch

      public static void launch(YldGame game, GameConfiguration configuration)
      This is the method that will create an YldGame instance receiving a GameConfiguration variable, it will set all the game based in the GameConfiguration instance.
      Parameters:
      game - The YldGame to be created.
      configuration - The YldGame instance of the GameConfiguration class.
      Since:
      4_alpha1

    • updateScene

      public final void updateScene(float delta, SampleGraphics graphics)
      Update the scene, and if it's the first frame, call the create() method on all systems and the scene itself. The first thing we do is check if the scene has been updated before. If it hasn't, we call the create() method on all systems and the scene itself. This is done by checking if the system implements the SystemCreateMethod interface, and if it does, we call the create() method on it.
      Parameters:
      delta - The time in seconds since the last frame.
      graphics - The graphics object that is used to draw the scene.

    • processFilters

      public Engine processFilters(Texture texture, int fps, boolean stopAfterSame)
      It creates an engine that processes the filters on a texture
      Parameters:
      texture - The texture to process
      fps - The frames per second of the engine.
      stopAfterSame - If true, the engine will stop after the texture is the same as the past colors.
      Returns:
      An engine that processes the filters on the texture.

    • overlayTexture

      public Texture overlayTexture(Texture tex1, Texture tex2, Vector2 pos1, Vector2 pos2)
      It overlays two textures on top of each other
      Parameters:
      tex1 - The first texture to be overlayed.
      tex2 - The texture to overlay
      pos1 - The position of the first texture.
      pos2 - The position of the second texture.
      Returns:
      A texture.

    • setTexturePixels

      public void setTexturePixels(Texture texture, Color[][] colors)
      Sets the colors of the pixels of the given texture to the given colors.
      Parameters:
      texture - The texture to set the pixels of.
      colors - A 2D array of colors. The first dimension is the x coordinate, the second is the y coordinate.

    • loadFont

      public void loadFont(String fontName, float size, int format, RelativeFile fontFile)
      Loads a font from a file, and if the file is marked to be flushed after load, flush it.
      Parameters:
      fontName - The name of the font.
      size - The size of the font.
      format - 0 = Bitmap, 1 = Vector.
      fontFile - The file that contains the font.

    • loadFont

      public void loadFont(String fontName, float size, float sizeToLoad, int format, RelativeFile fontFile)
      Loads a font from a file, and if the file is marked to be flushed after load, flush it.
      Parameters:
      fontName - The name of the font.
      size - The size of the font to be loaded.
      sizeToLoad - The size of the font to load.
      format - The format of the font file. This can be one of the following:
      fontFile - The file to load the font from.

    • loadFont

      public void loadFont(String fontName, float size, int style)
      Loads a font with the given name, size, and style
      Parameters:
      fontName - The name of the font.
      size - The size of the font.
      style - Font.PLAIN, Font.BOLD, Font.ITALIC, Font.BOLD + Font.ITALIC
